{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient has asymptomatic diabetes with abnormal fasting blood glucose levels. The diagnosis is based on demonstrable abnormalities in blood glucose levels. There are no symptoms of florid diabetes. Therefore, the patient does not have classical symptoms of diabetes and high glucose in blood and urine making the diagnosis easy. Asymptomatic diabetes requires a fasting blood glucose level over 125 mg per 100 ml for confirmation. The oral glucose tolerance test confirms the presence of diabetes. Since there is no mention of any other conditions that could contribute to insulin resistance, such as polycystic ovary syndrome or metabolic syndrome, it is likely that this patient has type 2 diabetes.", "answer_choice": B}
